p: Data from Table 3, showed that 30 days exposure to malathion-provoked a significant depletion ( P < 0.05) of different sperm parameters such as epididymal sperm concentration (7.36 ± 2.00 to 2.76 ± 1.00 10 6/mL), motility (69.00 ± 7.00% to 40.00 ± 5.00%), viability (79.00 ± 4.00% to 22 .00 ± 6.00%), sperm count (132.00 ± 16.40 to 96.00 ± 1.98 10 6/g epididymis) and testicular spermatids count (200.00 ± 9.30 to 118.00 ± 5.89), while, the number of dead sperm increased remarkably ( P < 0.05) (Table 3). Added to that, malathion-produced a significant decrease of viability, thiols-groups and DNA-decompaction as assessed by flow cytometry using monobromobimane (MB), propidium iodide (PI), chromomycine A3 (CMA3) as a probe (Figs. 2, 3 and 4).
